{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graduate Trainee (Logistics Officer)",
  "description": "The Candel FZE is a manufacturing company engaged in the development, production, marketing and distribution of agrochemicals, specialised fertilisers, seeds and allied products in Nigeria. It is located in the Lekki Free Zone, Ibeju- Lekki, Lagos; near Dangote Refinery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graduate Trainee (Logistics Officer)

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibeju-Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Graduate Trainee (Logistics Officer) will undergo structured training in the company&rsquo;s logistics and supply chain operations.
	This role is designed to build knowledge and skills in inventory management, warehouse operations, transportation coordination, and documentation processes.
	The trainee will work closely with the logistics team to ensure smooth and efficient movement of goods from suppliers to customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in maintaining accurate records of incoming and outgoing goods.
	Participate in supervising the loading and offloading of materials and finished products.
	Support the tracking and coordination of shipments with transporters and drivers.
	Assist with inventory checks, stock reconciliation, and warehouse organization.
	Learn and participate in preparing import/export documentation.
	Support the follow-up on delivery schedules to ensure timely arrivals.
	Participate in monthly reconciliations with finance and other departments.
	Assist in ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards during the handling of goods.
	Engage in cross-departmental collaboration to understand the entire supply chain process.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in a single or combined honours program from a recognized Nigerian University.
	0 - 2 years of work experience (fresh graduates encouraged to apply).
	Strong interest in logistics and supply chain operations.
	Good communication, analytical, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and basic data analysis.
	Ability to work well in a team and follow instructions.
	Not more than 30 years old.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@candelcorp.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-10",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Graduate Trainee (Logistics Officer) Job at  Candel FZE




        
    

        
        The Candel FZE is a manufacturing company engaged in the development, production, marketing and distribution of agrochemicals, specialised fertilisers, seeds and allied products in Nigeria. It is located in the Lekki Free Zone, Ibeju- Lekki, Lagos; near Dangote Refinery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graduate Trainee (Logistics Officer)

Job Location: Ibeju-Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Graduate Trainee (Logistics Officer) will undergo structured training in the company’s logistics and supply chain operations.
	This role is designed to build knowledge and skills in inventory management, warehouse operations, transportation coordination, and documentation processes.
	The trainee will work closely with the logistics team to ensure smooth and efficient movement of goods from suppliers to customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in maintaining accurate records of incoming and outgoing goods.
	Participate in supervising the loading and offloading of materials and finished products.
	Support the tracking and coordination of shipments with transporters and drivers.
	Assist with inventory checks, stock reconciliation, and warehouse organization.
	Learn and participate in preparing import/export documentation.
	Support the follow-up on delivery schedules to ensure timely arrivals.
	Participate in monthly reconciliations with finance and other departments.
	Assist in ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards during the handling of goods.
	Engage in cross-departmental collaboration to understand the entire supply chain process.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in a single or combined honours program from a recognized Nigerian University.
	0 - 2 years of work experience (fresh graduates encouraged to apply).
	Strong interest in logistics and supply chain operations.
	Good communication, analytical, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and basic data analysis.
	Ability to work well in a team and follow instructions.
	Not more than 30 years old.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@candelcorp.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Administrative Manager",
  "description": "Interrand Homes &amp; Properties Limited (subsidiary of Interrand Group) is a reputable Construction and Real Estate Development company with offices in Abuja, Lagos and Ibadan.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Gudu, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	Interrand Homes &amp; Properties Ltd, a growing real estate and construction firm in Abuja, is looking for an experienced and highly organized Administrative Manager to oversee our day-to-day administrative operations.
	We need someone who has actually worked within the real estate space, someone who understands how the industry moves, the pace, the pressure and the kind of coordination it demands.
	If you&rsquo;re steady, proactive and comfortable managing both people and processes, this might be a great fit.


Job Responsibilities


	Oversee daily administrative activities across departments.
	Implement and improve internal processes, policies and workflow systems.
	Supervise administrative staff and ensure optimal performance.
	Coordinate office logistics, documentation, records and correspondence.
	Support HR functions such as recruitment, onboarding and compliance.
	Ensure smooth communication between management, staff and external partners.
	Manage facility operations, supplies and vendor relationships.
	Prepare periodic administrative reports for management review.
	Maintain a well-structured and efficient work environment.


Key Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in Business Administration, Management or related fields.
	Minimum of 7 years of professional experience, with at least 5 years in the real estate sector.
	Strong administrative and operational management experience.
	Excellent organizational and multitasking ability.
	Strong understanding of real estate processes, documentation and workflow.
	Good communication and leadership skills.
	Proficiency with Microsoft Office and basic administrative software.
	Ability to manage staff performance, coordinate teams and maintain structure.
	High level of professionalism, integrity and attention to detail.
	Relevant professional certifications are an added advantage.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@interrandgroup.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Administrative Manager &ndash; Abuja&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Administrative Manager Job at Interrand Homes & Properties Limited




        
    

        
        Interrand Homes & Properties Limited (subsidiary of Interrand Group) is a reputable Construction and Real Estate Development company with offices in Abuja, Lagos and Ibadan.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Manager
Job Location: Gudu, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Interrand Homes & Properties Ltd, a growing real estate and construction firm in Abuja, is looking for an experienced and highly organized Administrative Manager to oversee our day-to-day administrative operations.
	We need someone who has actually worked within the real estate space, someone who understands how the industry moves, the pace, the pressure and the kind of coordination it demands.
	If you’re steady, proactive and comfortable managing both people and processes, this might be a great fit.


Job Responsibilities


	Oversee daily administrative activities across departments.
	Implement and improve internal processes, policies and workflow systems.
	Supervise administrative staff and ensure optimal performance.
	Coordinate office logistics, documentation, records and correspondence.
	Support HR functions such as recruitment, onboarding and compliance.
	Ensure smooth communication between management, staff and external partners.
	Manage facility operations, supplies and vendor relationships.
	Prepare periodic administrative reports for management review.
	Maintain a well-structured and efficient work environment.


Key Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in Business Administration, Management or related fields.
	Minimum of 7 years of professional experience, with at least 5 years in the real estate sector.
	Strong administrative and operational management experience.
	Excellent organizational and multitasking ability.
	Strong understanding of real estate processes, documentation and workflow.
	Good communication and leadership skills.
	Proficiency with Microsoft Office and basic administrative software.
	Ability to manage staff performance, coordinate teams and maintain structure.
	High level of professionalism, integrity and attention to detail.
	Relevant professional certifications are an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@interrandgroup.com using “Administrative Manager – Abuja” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Staff",
  "description": "Welcome to Birchwood Montessori Academy, a family-owned and operated school with a deep commitment to nurturing the whole child. Our mission is to provide a dynamic Montessori education that empowers children to become compassionate, curious, and capable individuals, well-prepared for a lifetime of learning and leadership.

We envision a world where each child&rsquo;s unique potential is celebrated and nurtured &mdash; where education is a journey of self-discovery that ignites passion and lifelong curiosity. Rooted in Montessori philosophy and enriched by best practices, we aim to build a future generation of thinkers, leaders, and change-makers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Staff
Job Location:&nbsp;Fate GRA, Ilorin - Kwara
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	The preschool front desk receptionist is responsible for providing excellent customer service to parents and visitors, maintaining accurate records, and supporting administrative tasks.
	They will be the first point of contact for families and will play a key role in creating a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for all who enter the preschool.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet parents, children, and visitors in a friendly and welcoming manner.
	Answer phone calls and emails, and respond to inquiries in a timely and professional manner.
	Maintain accurate records of attendance, enrollment, and student information using the preschool&#39;s database software.
	Support administrative tasks such as filing, copying, and distributing paperwork.
	Maintain a clean and organized front office area.
	Monitor visitor access and maintain security protocols.
	Assist with special events and activities as needed.


Requirements


	High school diploma or equivalent, with some coursework in early childhood education or related field preferred.
	Relevant experience in a receptionist or customer service role, preferably in a school or early childhood education setting.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with parents, colleagues, and visitors.
	Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize responsibilities.
	Knowledge of standard office equipment and software, including word processing, email, and database management.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in record keeping.
	Professional demeanor and ability to maintain confidentiality.


Physical Demands:


	The preschool front desk receptionist will spend most of their workday sitting and using a computer, phone, and other office equipment.
	They may need to lift and carry boxes or supplies, and must be able to move around the front office area as needed.


Working Conditions:


	The preschool front desk receptionist will work in a front office setting, with occasional interaction with children and teachers.
	They will work a typical 8-hour workday, with occasional evening or weekend events.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated&nbsp;CV to:&nbsp;Info@thebirchwoodacademy.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.",

Front Desk Staff Job at Birchwood Montessori Academy




        
    

        
        Welcome to Birchwood Montessori Academy, a family-owned and operated school with a deep commitment to nurturing the whole child. Our mission is to provide a dynamic Montessori education that empowers children to become compassionate, curious, and capable individuals, well-prepared for a lifetime of learning and leadership.

We envision a world where each child’s unique potential is celebrated and nurtured — where education is a journey of self-discovery that ignites passion and lifelong curiosity. Rooted in Montessori philosophy and enriched by best practices, we aim to build a future generation of thinkers, leaders, and change-makers.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Staff
Job Location: Fate GRA, Ilorin - Kwara
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	The preschool front desk receptionist is responsible for providing excellent customer service to parents and visitors, maintaining accurate records, and supporting administrative tasks.
	They will be the first point of contact for families and will play a key role in creating a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for all who enter the preschool.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet parents, children, and visitors in a friendly and welcoming manner.
	Answer phone calls and emails, and respond to inquiries in a timely and professional manner.
	Maintain accurate records of attendance, enrollment, and student information using the preschool's database software.
	Support administrative tasks such as filing, copying, and distributing paperwork.
	Maintain a clean and organized front office area.
	Monitor visitor access and maintain security protocols.
	Assist with special events and activities as needed.


Requirements


	High school diploma or equivalent, with some coursework in early childhood education or related field preferred.
	Relevant experience in a receptionist or customer service role, preferably in a school or early childhood education setting.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with parents, colleagues, and visitors.
	Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize responsibilities.
	Knowledge of standard office equipment and software, including word processing, email, and database management.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in record keeping.
	Professional demeanor and ability to maintain confidentiality.


Physical Demands:


	The preschool front desk receptionist will spend most of their workday sitting and using a computer, phone, and other office equipment.
	They may need to lift and carry boxes or supplies, and must be able to move around the front office area as needed.


Working Conditions:


	The preschool front desk receptionist will work in a front office setting, with occasional interaction with children and teachers.
	They will work a typical 8-hour workday, with occasional evening or weekend events.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: Info@thebirchwoodacademy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

  "title": "Warehouse Supervisor",
  "description": "Stellar International Company Limited - The company is a subsidiary of RSIN Group which entered Africa in 2008. Stellar International Co. Ltd has three businesses, namely Recycling Ant, Ant Express and Antshop Online.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a dedicated and experienced Warehouse Supervisor to join our team.
	The ideal candidate must be organized, proactive, and capable of overseeing warehouse operations efficiently.
	If you have strong leadership skills and experience in warehouse management, this is a great opportunity to grow with us.


Responsibilities


	Oversee daily warehouse operations and ensure smooth workflow.
	Supervise and coordinate the activities of warehouse staff.
	Ensure proper receipt, storage, and dispatch of goods.
	Monitor inventory levels and maintain accurate stock records.
	Implement safety standards and ensure compliance with company policies.
	Conduct regular checks to ensure proper handling of items and prevent damage or loss.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly warehouse reports.
	Work closely with other departments to support overall company operations.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND qualification; HND/BSc is an added advantage.
	Proven experience as a warehouse supervisor or in a similar role.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to use warehouse management tools and basic computer applications.
	Knowledge of inventory control and stock management procedures.
	Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Must reside in Port Harcourt.


Salary
N80,000 - N120,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;antonlineshopping5@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.",

Warehouse Supervisor Job at Stellar International Company Limited




        
    

        
        Stellar International Company Limited - The company is a subsidiary of RSIN Group which entered Africa in 2008. Stellar International Co. Ltd has three businesses, namely Recycling Ant, Ant Express and Antshop Online.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a dedicated and experienced Warehouse Supervisor to join our team.
	The ideal candidate must be organized, proactive, and capable of overseeing warehouse operations efficiently.
	If you have strong leadership skills and experience in warehouse management, this is a great opportunity to grow with us.


Responsibilities


	Oversee daily warehouse operations and ensure smooth workflow.
	Supervise and coordinate the activities of warehouse staff.
	Ensure proper receipt, storage, and dispatch of goods.
	Monitor inventory levels and maintain accurate stock records.
	Implement safety standards and ensure compliance with company policies.
	Conduct regular checks to ensure proper handling of items and prevent damage or loss.
	Prepare and submit daily, weekly, and monthly warehouse reports.
	Work closely with other departments to support overall company operations.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND qualification; HND/BSc is an added advantage.
	Proven experience as a warehouse supervisor or in a similar role.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to use warehouse management tools and basic computer applications.
	Knowledge of inventory control and stock management procedures.
	Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Must reside in Port Harcourt.


Salary
N80,000 - N120,000 monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: antonlineshopping5@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Accountant – Fleet",
  "description": "Helean Global Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in Nigeria with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their businesses through our core services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant &ndash; Fleet

Job Location:&nbsp;Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Oversee invoicing, monitor collections, and ensure proper revenue recognition
	Ensure accurate reporting of project and company-wide financial performance, maintaining compliance with IFRS and internal policies
	Verify supplier invoices, process payments to contractors and vendors, and maintain updated reconciliation of payable accounts
	Track expenses, materials, and stock usage for the site
	Provide necessary schedules, documentation, and explanations to auditors, ensuring smooth and timely audit closure
	Prepare and file VAT, WHT, and CIT schedules, ensuring timely remittances and adherence to tax regulations
	Maintain complete and organized financial records, update the accounting system, and ensure audit-ready documentation.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related fields
	5 years of experience in similar role
	A professional accounting certification (ACA, ACCA)
	Experience in Project reporting and company-wide financial performance
	Proficient in the use of SAP.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;careers@heleanglobal.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Accountant – Fleet Job at Helean Global Limited




        
    

        
        Helean Global Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in Nigeria with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their businesses through our core services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant – Fleet

Job Location: Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee invoicing, monitor collections, and ensure proper revenue recognition
	Ensure accurate reporting of project and company-wide financial performance, maintaining compliance with IFRS and internal policies
	Verify supplier invoices, process payments to contractors and vendors, and maintain updated reconciliation of payable accounts
	Track expenses, materials, and stock usage for the site
	Provide necessary schedules, documentation, and explanations to auditors, ensuring smooth and timely audit closure
	Prepare and file VAT, WHT, and CIT schedules, ensuring timely remittances and adherence to tax regulations
	Maintain complete and organized financial records, update the accounting system, and ensure audit-ready documentation.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related fields
	5 years of experience in similar role
	A professional accounting certification (ACA, ACCA)
	Experience in Project reporting and company-wide financial performance
	Proficient in the use of SAP.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@heleanglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
